entry.title: SAP INSIDE TRACK Kolkata 2025: A Vibe, A Vision, A Voyage!
entry.content:
üñ•Ô∏è Code ü§ù Community ‚ú® Collaboration

I had the absolute honor of volunteering with the help of @DataTherapist  at one of the most dynamic SAP community events of the year, SIT KOLKATA 2025 ‚Äî and wow, what an experience! üí•

Being part of the engine that powered this event gave me a front-row seat to the magic of collaboration and innovation.

üí¨ Keynote - To Boost the Journey

@josh_bentley , Srini reddy Gottimukkula, Pankaj Lal and Revarand Dr. John Felix Raj keynote gave a boost start of the event.

üé§ Sessions that challenged perspectives

Panel Discussion driven by Monimoy Kundu with Sharmistha Sanyal, Pankaj Lal, Prasun Dutta, Debashis Majumder and Tilak Kumar. Another panel discussion driven by Amitava Nag with Prof. Amlan Chakrabarti, Dr. Indranil Mitra, Dr. Saptarsi Goswami, Mr. Sabyasachi Biswas, Mr. Manoj Mishra and Srini reddy Gottimukkula.

Supply Chain Transformation through AI by Jayabharathy Jothiprakasam, Warehouse Operation by Next-Gen AI Mobile Application by Avik Poddar.

Moving forward a great Cloud ALM Roadshow, driven by Sunil Chopra. Afterwards an excellent session on SAP Business Data Cloud by Srini reddy Gottimukkula and Jitendra Ghanta.

ü§ù People who inspired me beyond words

Awesome Joule demonstration by Kousik Goon gave us a lot of insights, then Business AI with S/4 Hana delivered by Sangeeta Majumdar and GenAI Assets and Process of IBM by Aditi Chatterjee and Avijit Dhar. Moving forward great session by Arit Basu on Invoicing using SAP Business Network and SAP SAM 2505 session delivered by Abhishek Chatterjee had a powerful impact.

Then, Ritesh Agrawal delivered a session on embedding GenAI into Business Strategy, Sumanta Basu gave his insights on SAP conversational and GenAI - Bengali Chatbot, Partha Goswami conducted a session on how one can start their journey as an AI Engineer, Arghadip Kar delivered a impactful session on pre-requisities of S/4 Hana transformation, Foundation for GenAI with SAP - this great insights delivered by Vishwa Vivek Anand.

Later on, a session of SAP on AWS delivered by Amitava Nag, insights on data engineering with databricks given by Mohammad Afsar Imam, another session on Lakeflow Connect Overview delivered by Krishnendu Hazra and lastly insights on Retails Analytics on Databricks delivered by Pritam Paul.

A big thank you to the primary sponsor Westernacher Consulting and venue partner St. Xavier's University for the continuous support. Also, support by SAP PRESS, Linc Limited is commendable.

Also, thank you to all the speakers and tremendous efforts by other fellow volunteers for make this event such insightful and interesting.

Volunteering here wasn‚Äôt just about giving back ‚Äî it was about growing forward. And I‚Äôm walking away with new skills, new friends, and a renewed sense of purpose.üåü

#SAPInsideTrack #SITKolkata2025 #SAPCommunity #VolunteeringWithPurpose #TechWithHeart #GratefulAndGrowing #BehindTheScenesMagic

entry.title: Re: RRB Billing by Activity Type (Consultant Roles) and Q...
entry.content:
Yes, DIP profile summarization by activity type is the correct approach to achieve billing by consultant role. In SAP, Activity Types are typically mapped to roles like Senior Consultant, Junior Consultant, etc. The DIP profile can be configured to summarize costs by activity type, allowing you to group billing items accordingly. This setup ensures that the billing document reflects role-based cost aggregation, rather than WBS element-based breakdown.
Use Transaction ODP1 to define your DIP profile. In the Characteristics section, enable summarization by:

  • Activity Type
  • Transaction Currency
  • Unit of Measure

In Material Determination, map each activity type to a corresponding sales material (e.g., ‚ÄúSenior Consultant Hours‚Äù).

Coming to output, yes you are right again. SD quotations typically show a single service line item, but your client wants a hierarchical breakdown of roles and hours under a package like ‚ÄúCloud Implementation.‚Äù

  • What you can do is expand the DIP profile logic to include consultant roles and hours. Use a custom form to display this breakdown in the quotation output. This is the most flexible and widely used approach.
  • ECP allows you to plan services and costs in a structured way. You can define service packages and subcomponents (roles, hours). However, ECP is more suited for internal planning and cost estimation, not necessarily for SD quotation output unless tightly integrated.

If you're on S/4HANA, the Solution Quotation process allows bundling services and products. You can define a ‚ÄúCloud Implementation‚Äù package and explode it into sub-items like consultant roles and hours. This supports automatic follow-up documents (e.g., service orders) and can be enhanced with output control

entry.title: Enabling Background Job Execution in S/4HANA from Fiori Using CDS and OData
entry.content:
Business Scenario

Imagine a purchasing department needing to update material prices based on market conditions. Instead of manually running a report in background mode, users can select materials in a Fiori app and click ‚ÄúUpdate Prices‚Äù, which triggers a background job with selected data. 

Component Purpose

CDS ViewFor showing material list in Fiori
OData Function ImportTriggers a background job
Fiori AppAllows selection + button click
ABAP ReportExecutes price update logic
SM37Monitor the job execution

Step-by-Step Implementation 

Step 1: CDS View for Material Selection 

This will expose a simple material list for selection.

Step 2: Create SEGW Project and Import CDS View 

  • T-code: SEGW 
  • Create project: Z_MATERIAL_JOB_API 
  • Import CDS view as Entity Type 
  • Generate runtime artifacts 

Step 3: Add Function Import to SEGW 

  1. In SEGW: 
  1. Right-click Data Model ‚Üí Function Imports ‚Üí Create

  2.  

     Name: TRIGGER_PRICE_JOB 
  3. Return Type: None 
  4. HTTP Method: POST 

2. In Modeling, assign an Entity Set if needed (optional). 

Step 4: Implement Function Import Logic 

In class: ZCL_Z_MATERIAL_JOB_API_DPC_EXT 

method /iwbep/if_mgw_appl_srv_runtime~execute_action. 
 
  data: lv_jobname type tbtcjob value 'ZPRICE_UPDATE_JOB', 
        lv_jobcount type tbtco-jobcount, 
        lv_msg type string, 
        lt_materials type standard table of mara-matnr. 
 
  if iv_action_name = 'TRIGGER_PRICE_JOB'. 
 
    " (Optional) collect materials from CDS selection or payload 
    append 'MATERIAL1' to lt_materials. 
    append 'MATERIAL2' to lt_materials. 
 
    " Submit the job 
    call function 'JOB_OPEN' 
      exporting 
        jobname          = lv_jobname 
      importing 
        jobcount         = lv_jobcount 
      exceptions 
        others           = 1. 
 
    if sy-subrc = 0. 
      " Submit custom report in background 
      submit zmat_price_update_report 
        with so_matnr in lt_materials 
        user sy-uname 
        via job lv_jobname 
        number lv_jobcount 
        and return. 
 
      call function 'JOB_CLOSE' 
        exporting 
          jobname     = lv_jobname 
          jobcount    = lv_jobcount 
          strtimmed   = 'X' 
        exceptions 
          others      = 1. 
 
      lv_msg = |Job { lv_jobname } triggered successfully.|. 
 
    else. 
      lv_msg = 'Job could not be started.'. 
    endif. 
 
    " Send response back to OData 
    data: lr_return type ref to /iwbep/if_message_container. 
    lr_return = me->get_message_container( ). 
    lr_return->add_message( 
      exporting 
        iv_msg_text   = lv_msg 
        iv_msg_type   = /iwbep/if_message_container=>gcs_msg_type-success 
    ). 
 
  endif. 
 
endmethod.

Step 5: Background Report ZMAT_PRICE_UPDATE_REPORT

REPORT zmat_price_update_report. 
 
PARAMETERS: so_matnr TYPE mara-matnr RANGE. 
 
START-OF-SELECTION.	 
 
  LOOP AT so_matnr INTO DATA(lr). 
    " Dummy logic - Simulate price update 
    WRITE: / 'Updating price for material:', lr-low. 
  ENDLOOP.

Output ‚Äì What Happens in Fiori

  1. User opens the Fiori app showing materials from CDS.

  2. Selects a few materials ‚Üí clicks ‚ÄúUpdate Prices‚Äù.

  3. The TRIGGER_PRICE_JOB function import is called.

  4. SAP triggers a job: ZPRICE_UPDATE_JOB

  5. The custom report runs in background ‚Üí check SM37

Log: 

Conclusion:

This approach bridges Modern UI and robust backend logic. You can now let Fiori apps initiate background-heavy tasks ‚Äî like price updates, data migration, or batch jobs ‚Äî with traceable and efficient execution.

entry.title: Re: Position of SAC input control check box
entry.content:
Hi,

Not possible with any standard functionality in SAC. It would be possible through the use of a custom widget to inject some custom css. The following example in the below screenshot has two checkbox widgets. The one on the left has a class added to the widget which is targeted by the custom css. The one on the right is identical but without the class.

The custom css injected is as follows:

.sap-user-defined-customBox label.sapFpaAppBuildingUiCheckboxWrapper {
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: row-reverse;
}

This leverages css flex to reverse the display order of the elements inside each row of the checkbox group.

For the custom css widget, please see: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-q-a/is-there-a-way-to-maintain-or-upload-custom-css-files-in-sap-analytics/qaa-p/14044971/highlight/true#M4907197

Cheers, Ivan.

entry.title: Creating a Formula Expression in BRF+
entry.content:
Business Scenario
We want to determine the Pension Bonus Amount based on:
Employee Service Years
Pension Bonus Base Amount
The formula might look like:
Pension Bonus Amount = Pension Bonus Base Amount x Service Years

Step-by-Step: Creating the Formula Expression in BRF+
Step 1: Create a Formula Expression
Navigate to your BRF+ Application.
Click on Create -> Expression -> Formula.

Enter a name for the formula, e.g., Formula_1, and click Create.

 

Formula Expression is created here we can create formula by two modes Normal mode and Expert mode

 

Normal Mode and Expert Mode
Normal Mode
User-Friendly Interface: Designed for users who prefer a simplified, guided way of creating formulas.
Predefined Options: You select from predefined functions, operators, and variables.
Limited Flexibility: Less control over complex logic; suitable for straightforward formulas.
Use Case: Ideal for users who want to quickly create formulas without delving into intricate details or custom logic.
Expert Mode
Advanced Features: Offers a more powerful and flexible environment.
Direct Formula Editing: You can directly write and edit the formula expressions, often in a text-based way.
Greater Control: Supports complex logic, nested functions, and custom expressions.
Customization: Allows more detailed and precise formula definitions.
Use Case: Suitable for advanced users or scenarios requiring complex logic that cannot be easily achieved in normal mode.


Step 2: Define Data Elements (Mass Creation)
We need to define three key data elements:
Pension Bonus Amount (Result)
Pension Bonus Base Amount
Service Years
To create these:
Go to Application -> Create -> Data Object -> Element (Mass Creation).
Define each required element with the appropriate data type (e.g., Amount, Integer, etc.).

 

Add resultant data object

click on result data object click on `Search'
Select required field

 

Step 3: Build the Formula
Place your cursor after the | next to the Result Data Object.
Click on Insert Data Object and select:
Pension Bonus Base Amount and Service Years

 

Step 4: Test the Expression (Simulation)
Click Start Simulation.
Enter test values for:
Pension Bonus Base Amount (e.g., 300)
Service Years (e.g., 10)
Click Execute.   

You should see the calculated Pension Bonus Amount
We get the output

 

 

Conclusion
Formula Expressions in BRF+ are a powerful tool for creating dynamic business rules and performing calculations using business context data. With both Normal and Expert modes available, users at any skill level can build and manage rules effectively‚Äîoften without needing to write custom ABAP code.

In our example, we used a Formula Expression to calculate the Pension Bonus Amount based on an employee‚Äôs years of service and a base bonus value‚Äîsomething commonly needed in HR and payroll systems.

This process is fairly simple. When ONB2.0 is enabled, the system will prefer initiation into ONB2.0. Unless you specify different criteria under Onboarding Integration Settings, all Initiate Onboarding actions will flow to ONB2.0.

entry.title: Google Play requires that apps target API level 35 or higher
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I recently received a notification from Google Play stating that my app must target API level 35 or higher by August 31, 2025, to comply with their new requirements. Currently, my target SDK is set to API level 34.

Here is the message from Google Play 

*Google Play requires that apps target API level 35 or higher.

Update your target API level by August 31, 2025, to publish updates to your app. We have detected that your app targets an older version of Android. To provide users with a secure experience, Google Play requires all apps to meet the target API level requirements.

As of August 31, 2025, if your target API level is more than one year old compared to the latest Android release, you will not be able to update your app.*

Could someone guide me through the process of updating the target API level in SAP Build Apps? 

Thank you,

entry.title: CPI-DS: IBP Data Store Creation, Certifications upload and .pse file creation via linux
entry.content:
Step:1

Communication between CPI-DS and IBP

  1. Create the Communication User:
  • Create a new communication user. Provide some logical name as this will be the user for setting up the WebSocket RFC connection in CI-DS.
  • You can enter the password or select the Proposed password. If you use Proposed password, then you need to make a note of this. 
  1. Create the Communication System: 
  • Create a new communication system for WebSocket RFC

  • Select the Inbound Only 

  • Select the Users for Inbound Communication and add the communication user.

  3. Communication Arrangement:

  • Create the communication arrangement and select scenario SAP_COM_0593, and provide an arrangement name.

  • You need to add the communication system created in the step 2. The user is automatically populated as it was configured in the selected communication system. 

Step 2:

Data Services Agent Machine

  1.  Download and place the IBP Server Certificate in the SAP Data Service Agent Machine. 

The first step would be download the Current and New Root Certificate for IBP. You should download both the root CA certificate "DigiCert Global Root CA" and "DigiCert Global Root G2" https://www.digicert.com/kb/digicert-root-certificates.htm#roots

    • Download the Root Certificate of DigiCert Global Root Serial #: 08:3B:E0:56:90:42:46:B1:A1:75:6A:C9:59:91:C7:4A 
    • Download the Root Certificate of DigiCert Global Root G2 with Serial #: 03:3A:F1:E6:A7:11:A9:A0:BB:28:64:B1:1D:09:FA:E5
  • Move or download these certificates in the SAP Data Services Agent machine. 
  1. Setting up the PSE File
  • Navigate to <agent_installation_folder>/bin and execute the command to generate the PSE File
    • Linux : ./sapgenpse.sh get_pse ‚Äìp ibp_no_password.pse -x WebSocket123!

Distinguished Name (DN): CN=IBPROCKS, O=SAP, C=US 

DN: The distinguished name. This must be unique per PSE file.
 
CN = <Common_Name> OU = <Organizational_Unit> O = <Organization> C = <Country>
For example, "CN=IBPROCKS, O=SAP, C=US"

  • Run sapgenpse seclogin. Here the <user_ID> has to be same as the logon user for DS agent service.
    • Linux: ./sapgenpse.sh seclogin -p ibp_no_password.pse -x WebSocket123! -O \DS_USER

  • Add IBP Server Certificate to PSE File. You should add both certificates "DigiCert Global Root CA" and "DigiCert Global Root G2" downloaded in the step 1.
  • You can execute the following command to add the Root Certificate in the PSE File. Please note that you need to execute the command twice to add both certificates. 
    • Linux:  ./sapgenpse.sh maintain_pk -a /home/ccloud/certificates/DigiCertGlobalRootG2.crt -p ibp_no_password.pse -x WebSocket123!

  • You can execute the following command to list the added certificates in the PSE File. Both "DigiCert Global Root CA" and "DigiCert Global Root G2"  should be shown as below:  
    • Linux: ./sapgenpse.sh maintain_pk -p ibp_no_password.pse -l -x WebSocket123!

Restart the SAP Data Services Agent. 

    • For Linux, you need to go to back to main directory
      • ./dsod_stop.sh (Stopping the agent)
      • ./dsod_start.sh (Starting the agent)  

Step 3:

Create the IBP Datastore in CPI-DS

Test the connection for IBP datastore:

Kindly Note: even though the test connection is successful for IBP Datastore. the Import options are not enabled for Master data, Transactional data & rest all folders. 

In addition, we tried with executing the connection in between FF to IBP or S4 to IBP tasks. and facing the error as below.

To fix the issue: Change the proxy connection in the IBP Datastore as given in below.

now, able to run the task with configuration as expected.

Regards,MK

entry.title: Re: ABAP Extensibility Guide ‚Äì Clean Core for SAP S/4HANA Cloud - August 2025 Update

I suggest to have the destination selectable on the Build Apps project level.

Cheers!

entry.title: Re: WHAT IS THE DIFF BETWEEN Requirement Qty AND Base Qua...
entry.content:
SAP will consider the Requirement Quantity in Base UoM. Having said that, if the component has a different unit of measure in its material master (e.g., KG, M, L), SAP converts it to EA using the conversion ratio. SAP allows decimal quantities for EA if the unit is configured to permit it in transaction CUNI. If EA is set to allow decimals, then 1.7 EA is valid and will be shown.  In standard configuration for EA, this will be blank.

In your case, is that, both the Base UoM and Ordering UoM are same? From your screen shot, I presume, they are different and hence, system is showing the Requirement Quantity in Base UoM as 1.7 which is different from EA

entry.title: Sourcing & Procurement - Bulgaria EUR Transition for S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Live Customers
entry.content:
This is only relevant for Partners and Live Customers who are required to transit Production system data with EUR adoption in Bulgaria. In the 3rd session offered by ASC Cloud ERP Expertise Services, the main topic covered is around Sourcing & Procurement.

  • Recording of the session will be uploaded shortly.
  • Presentation of the session can be found here
  • Accelerator checklist can be found here

Key Discussion Points

In this session we discussed the scope of impact that the euro transition has across sourcing and procurement, broken down into master data, transactional data, and manual activities.

‚Äå‚Äå1. Master Related Data

Supplier master and material master need to be extended and updated for the new EUR company code. Beyond that, objects such as source lists, purchase info records, purchasing condition records, and contracts must be exported, cleansed, and recreated in EUR to ensure accuracy and compliance.

 This is where a lot of the preparation work takes place, since these records underpin all procurement transactions.

‚Äå2. Transaction Related Data

Here we need to manage open items carefully. That means handling cutover inventory balances, open purchase requisitions, RFQs, supplier quotations, scheduling agreements, and purchase orders. These transactions cannot remain in BGN. They must either be closed out before cutover or recreated in EUR within the new organizational structure.

 3. Manual Activities

There are also Manual Activities that need attention, such as output determination, tax condition records, and workflow management. These are often overlooked but can have a significant impact if not properly adjusted, since they directly affect approvals, tax compliance, and document outputs.

4. Live Q&A

Topic Area‚Äå

‚ÄåQuestion‚Äå

‚ÄåAnswer‚Äå

‚ÄåSourcing & Procurement‚Äå

Is there a way for referring the new POs to the old ones?

A separate Number Range can be created for Open POs and newly created POs, a different series can help understand new Org structure Pos

‚ÄåSourcing & Procurement‚Äå

In case there are open PO for migration to the new org units they will be created with new numbers?

Yes, any PO that will be uploaded through Migration object will create a new PO

‚ÄåTest Automation Tool‚Äå

Content of test automation tool: Important things to check if this can be used, will the euro conversion be available before 2602 as current release is 2508?

We can suggest TOSCA for standard scope items here.

4. Call-to-Action

Register and Attend Upcoming Webinar presented by SAP Service experts with practical suggestions

  • [Aug 27th] Bulgaria EUR Transition for Live Customers (Data Migration)
  • [Sept 3rd] Bulgaria EUR Transition for Live Customers (Finance)
  • [Replay] Overview, IAM, Cutover Plan -Bulgaria EUR Transition for S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Live ...  

Please view all content and raise questions with tag #Bulgaria

entry.title: How are SAP teams ensuring compliance with MCA Rule 11(g)?
entry.content:
The MCA in India now mandates tamper-proof audit trails of all accounting transactions for 8 years. In SAP, that means more than just enabling table logging‚Äîit requires ensuring logs can‚Äôt be disabled or altered, monitoring them daily, and being audit-ready year-round.

Many believe SAP Notes cover this, but there are still gaps like missing alerts or admins being able to switch off logs.

What approaches or best practices are you using in your SAP landscape to meet these requirements?
(I came across a practical checklist here: Implementing the Right Controls for MCA Rule 11(g) in SAP)

entry.title: Re: Credit Card Settlement - Field under Payment Method i...
entry.content:
Some of the key areas you need to investigate are

  • Compare the POSDTA customizing between Pre-Prod and Quality. Check if the Credit Card Settlement segment is enabled or mapped correctly in Pre-Prod. Look into /POSDW/IMG ‚Üí Inbound Processing ‚Üí Segment Mapping and Field Mapping.
  • In Inbound Profile Settings, validate the Inbound Profile used in Pre-Prod. Ensure that the segment group for Credit Card Settlement is active and correctly assigned.
  • Are there any custom BAdIs or user exits that handle Credit Card data? If yes, confirm they‚Äôre transported and active in Pre-Prod.
  • Use transaction WE02 or WE05 to inspect the IDoc in Pre-Prod. Look for any errors, warnings, or skipped segments during processing.
  • Check if the RFC destination used by POSDTA in Pre-Prod has the correct permissions. Sometimes, missing authorizations can silently block segment population.
  • Finally and most importantly, engage your BASIS or Middleware team to confirm that middleware mappings (if any) are consistent across environments.

entry.title: Re: OB52 restrict changes after certain days
entry.content: Yes you cannot restrict via standard Authorization Object since it should work for a specific period. Consider Enhancement Spot FI_PERIOD_CHECK which is triggered during period opening/closing in transaction OB52 or related processes. You can add logic to check if the user is trying to open a prior period, compare the system date to the 15th business day of the current month and block the action with a custom error message if the rule is violated

entry.title: Re: Help creating a Data Provider for Forms created in AD...
entry.content:
Hi @diego_valentino, Following up on our discussion: You need to add the annotation analytics.query: true or odata.publish: true to your CDS view and it must be released as consumable. Then you will have to include analytics.dataCategory: #QUERY to mark the view as an analytics query. Thereafter, confirm that the CDS view is published or released in your tenant. Please note, only CDS views with these analytic annotations and not just released with C1 contract will appear as available Data Providers in ADT forms. If you meet these criteria, your CDS views should show up in the Data Provider selection. Standard Data Providers are being delivered incrementally, so not all are visible yet in 2508. SAP has not yet published full documentation for this, but official guidance is expected in upcoming releases.

Best regards

You can only import FA that are already in use, meaning that depreciation start date must be before the fiscal year you are importing into.

If depreciation start date is in 2024 or later, you need to use capitalization document instead of import functionality.

entry.title: Re: KO88 doesn't settle down payment to ASSET UNDER CONST...
entry.content:
According to SAP note 434622, down payments are excluded from KO88 settlement by design, unless modified. It explains that down payments are informational only in CO and not part of the settlement logic.

If your business requires automatic deduction of down payments during KO88, you‚Äôll need a custom modification or enhancement to include value type 12 in settlement logic. This is not recommended unless absolutely necessary, due to complexity and upgrade risk. So the recommended approach is after KO88, manually post a credit adjustment to the asset to reflect the down payment. This ensures the asset value reflects the net amount.

entry.title: Driving the Future of Utilities with SAP Intelligent Asset Management & Field Service
entry.content:
Introduction:

The utilities industry is at a turning point. Aging infrastructure, regulatory scrutiny, cost pressures and rising customer expectations are forcing utilities to redesign how they manage assets and deliver service. The mandate is operational excellence ‚Äì modernizing people, processes and technology with integrated solutions that lift asset performance, strengthen field service and build resilience. Condition-based and predictive maintenance, AI-driven automation and advanced field execution are now mainstream, shifting operations from reactive cost centers into engines of reliability and efficiency.

With SAP, utilities can combine the breadth of an integrated suite with our best-of-breed capabilities ‚Äì all built on unified data semantics that power AI automation. Natively integrated with SAP Cloud ERP (S/4HANA), SAP connects the entire asset lifecycle, spanning Enterprise Asset Management (EAM), Asset Performance Management (APM), Mobile Workforce Management (MWM) and Field Service Management (FSM) one integrated platform.

What‚Äôs different now? AI is embedded in the flow of work ‚Äì and SAP‚Äôs unified data fuels relevant and reliable AI. From workflow automation, predictive insights, policy-aware auto-scheduling, generative summaries and Joule agents acting as digital assistants, utilities can unlock value and drive quantifiable results.

The result: lower IT total cost of ownership, stronger operational connectivity, and measurable improvements in cost savings, risk reduction, and revenue growth.

See it in action: Watch the end-to-end demo video to explore how SAP Intelligent Asset Management and Field Service work together to transform asset and service-centric operations. 

 

Enterprise Asset Management ‚Äì The Digital Core:

SAP S/4HANA Asset Management anchors the asset lifecycle‚Äìfrom acquire to decommission‚Äìwith utility-specific capabilities:

  • Maintenance planning & scheduling: strategy and condition-based plans (driven by APM signals), native linear-asset maintenance for lines/pipes, capacity planning, and a clean hand-off to FSM for AI scheduling of technicians, crews and contractors.
  • Work order execution: notifications, permits/LOTO, health and safety, mobile execution (forms, measurements, e-signatures) and embedded geospatial context via GIS.
  • Resource & materials: align skilled labor, critical spares, and tools to the plan to reduce truck rolls and stock-outs.
  • Financial control: link work, assets and costs to transparent accounting and compliance for clear financials across the asset lifecycle.


Result: a single, compliant system of record for EAM that shortens maintenance cycles, aligns parts and resources, and readies work for AI-optimized field execution‚Äìwith cost transparency across the asset lifecycle and embedded asset accounting. 

Independent validation: reflecting high customer satisfaction in the enterprise asset management (EAM) market, IDC has awarded SAP the 2024 SaaS EAM Customer Satisfaction Award. This recognition underscores SAP‚Äôs dedication to delivering innovative solutions that empower organizations to achieve operational excellence and long-term sustainability.

Asset Performance Management ‚Äì From Insight to Action:

SAP Asset Performance Management (APM) is a decision-support tool that forecasts asset condition and behaviour, guiding what to do and when. Utilities can:

  • Predict and detect anomalies in real time to identify emerging risks and protect critical assets.
  • Optimize maintenance strategies using reliability modeling, FMEA, and risk-based frameworks to extend asset life and reduce lifecycle costs.
  • Integrate safety, regulatory, and compliance directly into operational strategies to ensure resilient, secure, and sustainable utility operations.
  • Extend EAM operations with APM capabilities with a unified data model built for SAP Cloud ERP. This means asset strategies flow directly into maintenance plans, work orders and field execution.

Example: A distribution transformer shows anomalies. APM flags risk and raises an alert (notification); planners approve work; FSM auto-schedules the right crew and outage window;  technicians execute via mobile with GIS context; completion data rolls back to EAM/APM to refine the strategy. This drives the closed loop from identify ‚Üí plan ‚Üí schedule ‚Üí dispatch ‚Üí execute ‚Üí analyze and drives a virtuous cycle of improvement for utilities. 


Result: higher reliability at lower cost by focusing crews on the highest-risk assets and continuously improving maintenance strategies by aligning reliability engineers and technicians on common shared outcomes. This scales reliability programs to help optimize asset uptime, improve safety, and extend asset lifecycles. 

Spatial Asset Management ‚Äì The Location Advantage:

Utilities need spatial context to make decisions. SAP‚Äôs spatial capabilities integrate GIS data directly into EAM and FSM so teams can:

  • Visualize assets, networks and environmental factors in spatial context to understand interdependencies, assess criticality, and guide decisions.
  • Use linear referencing to pinpoint work along pipelines, transmission lines or feeders.
  • Integrate GIS with SAP ‚Äì embedding asset and network context across SAP workflows for smarter decisions and safer operations.

Result: safer, faster decisions and prioritized work with full location/topology context across planning, dispatch, and execution.

Field Service Management ‚Äì Facilitating The Last Critical Mile:

When work must happen, SAP Field Service Management turns planning into execution:

  • AI scheduling & route optimization balances skills, SLAs, travel time, and availability across employees and contractors; configurable policy rules can adapt to storms, outage restoration, appointments, and more.
  • Broad utility coverage: outage restoration, emergency response, routine inspections, planned maintenance, break-fix, capital projects, upgrades and customer work (metering, connections, appointments), and many more. 
  • Blended workforce: Orchestrate employees, dynamic crews, and contractors in one schedule, with partner portals for onboarding, credential checks, and status updates.
  • Customer-centric delivery: manage omni-channel service, billing and invoicing in one flow within the SAP Business Suite; real-time KPIs help drive continous improvement. 

Result: faster restoration (lower MTTR), higher first-time-fix, and fewer truck rolls‚Äìwhile meeting SLAs and appointment windows.

Analyst recognition: SAP has been recognized as a Leader in both the IDC MarketScape: Worldwide Field Service Management Applications 2023-2024 Vendor Assessment (doc #US49989523, December 2023) and IDC MarketScape: Worldwide Service Life-Cycle Management Platforms 2023-2024 Vendor Assessment (doc #US49989623, October 2023).

Mobile Workforce Management ‚Äì Empowering Technicians Everywhere:

In vast utility territories‚Äìoften offline and across a variety of field scenarios for electric, gas, water, and renewables‚ÄìSAP enables safe, efficient field execution with native mobile apps:

  • Mobile-first & guided work: Offline job packs with asset history, digital forms, and step-by-step guided maintenance and safety checks.
  • Map-based workflows: GIS/spatial context embedded in the tech UI, with integration to specialized field/GIS apps when needed.
  • Technician-facing AI: Concise equipment/work summaries and smarter data capture that boost first-time fix and cut admin.
  • Configurable & extensible: Role-based, configurable UIs and forms; low-code extensions and integrations via SAP BTP.
  • Continuous feedback: Measurements, photos, and defect codes flow back to EAM/APM to improve strategies at scale.

Result: empowered technicians complete work right the first time‚Äìeven offline‚Äìwhile rich field data captured strengthens reliability engineering and elevates the customer experience. 

Business Networks ‚Äì No Utility Works Alone:

SAP Business Network Asset Collaboration (BNAC) connects OEMs, utilities and service partners to co-manage asset and digital-twin data across the lifecycle:

  • Connected asset registry ‚Äîacross electric (e.g., transformers, breakers, switchgear, meters, feeders/lines), gas (pipelines, regulators, valves, stations) and water/wastewater (mains, pumps, valves, lift stations, treatment assets)‚Äîwith asset data and engineering documents synchronized with S/4HANA Asset Management.
  • Collaborative asset definition: OEM bulletins, warranty/configuration updates and changes flow into equipment records.
  • Automated handover: commissioning packages (test reports, settings, spares lists) enrich equipment masters and start warranties.

Result: faster commissioning and fewer data defects as OEM updates and handover packages continuously enrich the SAP equipment record.

Closing Thoughts ‚Äì The SAP Advantage in Intelligent Asset Management & Field Service:

SAP brings decades of utility expertise and unifies EAM, APM, FSM, and MWM in the SAP Business Suite, giving you a single digital data thread from asset strategy to field execution. Unlike point solutions, SAP offers the breadth of an integrated suite with the functionality of best-of-breed ‚Äì reducing integration costs and ensuring process continuity across planning, execution, and financials.

SAP uniquely enables utilities to act autonomously with Business AI (predict, schedule, summarize), transact across the ecosystem with SAP Business Network (parts, OEM updates, contractors), and innovate with SAP BTP (extend, develop, integrate) ‚Äì all while keeping the core clean and operating on shared semantics in the Business Data Cloud.

This, combined with continuous innovation and a strong global partner ecosystem, SAP provides utilities with a comprehensive and future-ready platform for asset and field service management, enabling our customers to drive adoption at their own pace and GROW with SAP. 

 

The true measure of SAP Intelligent Asset Management & Field Service's impact is reflected in our customers' success. Discover how Utility companies are revolutionizing their asset management and field service practices and achieving operational excellence with SAP:

entry.title: Re: EWM Wrong Destination Storage Type found (Two-Step-Pi...
entry.content:
Even if the WPT has a destination bin defined, the system may override it using the Storage Type Search Sequence. Check /SCWM/STOR_TYPE_SEARCH and ensure that your desired storage type/bin is prioritized correctly.

SAP EWM can use Bin access strategies or Putaway rules that dynamically determine bins. Review the putaway control indicator in the product master and the Storage Type settings to see if any rules are influencing bin selection.

WOCRs can influence how tasks are grouped and which bins are selected. If your WOCR is configured to optimize bin usage or consolidate tasks, it might redirect the destination.

If you're working with Outbound Deliveries, check whether a staging bin is assigned at item level. Missing or incorrect staging bin entries can cause EWM to default to unexpected bins

Finally, ensure the Two-Step picking indicator is correctly set in the Warehouse Data tab of the product master. If it's not set to ‚Äú2‚Äù (product-level control), the system might not honor the WPT destination bin

entry.title: Re: Suggestion required for implementing DPC (Dynamic Per...
entry.content: Hi @diptarkaroy Please note, while DPC normally works with meter reading results, you can make it use the consumptions stored in installation facts which was imported via EBF by adapting the DPC schema and operand setup. First, store your EBF or legacy consumptions as quantity operands in installation facts. Then in your DPC schema, ensure you configure the time-slice generator variant to reference these operands instead of MR results. Update your rate categories so that the EBF operand is used as the base quantity operand for billing. For correction billing, the system will then use the stored fact values as inputs, ensuring alignment with legacy data. The summary is, by mapping your EBF consumption operands into your billing schema and rate categories, DPC will use them in correction billing just like MR-based consumptions. Hope this helps. Best regards Chris

entry.title: SAP Business Network for Logistics 2508 ‚Äì What‚Äôs New?
entry.content:
In an ever-evolving supply chain landscape, staying ahead of the curve with innovative solutions is crucial. SAP Business Network continues to lead with cutting-edge enhancements aimed at improving freight collaboration and global track and trace capabilities. This blog post will explore the latest updates of our 2508 release.

 

Cross SAP Business Network for Logistics

Simplified account activation in test environment

As a shipper or solution owner using the test environment, you can now invite your business partners as test carriers or test data contributors to the network using the ‚ÄòInvite Business Partners‚Äô app. Invitees can activate their accounts through the simplified account activation process and collaborate with you in the test environment. This enhancement streamlines the account activation process with the process that has already been available in the productive environment.

For more information about the simplified account activation process, see Getting Started with SAP Business Network for Logistics via New Onboarding Process.  For carriers, we also have how-to videos that describe the process.

 

Sunset of project44 legacy APIs

The project44 unified API now supports attachment for road LTL tracking. Following this, we have feature parity of legacy API and unified API. Thus, project44 legacy APIs are planned to be sunset as of February 2026. From then on, the following project44 connections won‚Äôt be available anymore in the ‚ÄôDiscover Business Partners‚Äô app:

Project44, Inc. (10010001289)

Project44, Inc. (10000478)

Project 44, Inc. - Legacy (200200001038)

Project44, Inc. - Legacy NA (20020001039)

To continue using project44 tracking services, you must switch to the project44 unified API. To do so, contact project44 and raise the request and adjust the configuration in SAP Business Network for Logistics. For details, see Configuration and Application Guide for project44 Add-Ons.

 

SAP Business Network Freight Collaboration

Dock Appointment Scheduling: Email notifications enhancement for shippers

Shippers now receive email notifications with detailed docking location addresses. To opt into these notifications, subscribe to the dock appointment scheduling scenario in the ‚ÄòManage Notification Settings‚Äô app.

Dock Appointment Scheduling: enhancements to in-app help in ‚ÄòManage Entities‚Äô app

Further in-app help functionality has been added to the ‚ÄòManage Entities‚Äô app, providing guidance on key fields like ‚ÄòAppointment Date Change‚Äô and ‚ÄòCut-Off Time for Appointment Creation‚Äô. Users can access this help by selecting the help icon in the upper right corner.

 

SAP Business Network Global Track and Trace

Connectivity: EDIFACT IFTSTA for Event Tracking

Users can now track key business events such as departures, arrivals, and delays using the message type EDIFACT IFTSTA for both inbound and outbound connections. Detailed instructions on enabling this feature for solution owners as well as data contributors are available here.

Planned rate limits for IDOC and write service API interfaces

The rate limits of the IDOC interface and Write Service API will be changed to the following as of November 20, 2025:

IDOC interface:

  • For each production tenant, you can send up to 10 requests per second.
  • For each test tenant, you can send up to 10 requests per second and 1000 requests per day.

Write Service API:

  • For each product tenant, you can send up to 5 requests per second and 150 requests per minute.
  • For each test tenant, you can send up to 5 requests per second, 150 requests per minute, and 1000 requests per day.

Once it takes effect, please ensure your requests won‚Äôt exceed these limits. Otherwise, they might be rejected.

‚ÄòManage Message Logs‚Äô app: adjust width of worklist table column

Solution owners can now freely adjust table column widths on the worklist page to enhance readability, eliminating truncated information.

‚ÄòManage Models‚Äô app: decimal digits for ‚ÄòEmission Intensity‚Äô value extended

To increase the precision of the ‚ÄòEmission Intensity‚Äô value, the number of digits on both sides of the decimal point is extended:

  • The integer part (to the left of the decimal point) is extended to 20 from 15.
  • The fractional part (to the right of the decimal point) is extended to 8 from 3.

All fulfillment tracking apps: event grouping in the tracking timeline

New functionality allows for the consolidation of duplicate events into single entries based on stop location and event type, improving visibility and tracking efficiency.

 

More information on the grouping of events in the tracking timeline can be found here.

‚ÄòTrack Shipments‚Äô app: search shipments by freight unit number

A new filter has been introduced on the worklist page of the ‚ÄòTrack Shipments‚Äô app, allowing users to search for shipments related to specified freight units, aiding multimodal transport coordination.

 

---------------------

The above summarizes the key innovations for 2508. We hope you enjoy the new capabilities. Thanks for reading the blog post and stay tuned! 

A full overview of the 2508 release can be found under the following link.

To learn more about SAP Business Network for Logistics visit SAP - Business Network for Logistics.

For further questions and feedback related to the blog, please check the Q&A area and feel free to post your questions in the link with the tag SAP Business Network for Logistics.

entry.title: Re: Functional Area not found in TCode GR55
entry.content:
Some of the possible reasons could be

GR55 reports only show functional areas that have posted data in the system. If no transactions (like FI documents, cost center postings, etc.) have been made using these functional areas, they won‚Äôt appear in the report.

Functional areas must be assigned to cost centers, profit centers, or cost elements depending on your setup. Check:

  • Cost Center Master Data (KS03) ‚Äì Is the functional area assigned?
  • Cost Element Master Data (KA03) ‚Äì Is the functional area linked?
  • Profit Center Master Data (KE53) ‚Äì Any assignment there?

GR55 uses report groups and report libraries. If the report group doesn‚Äôt include your functional areas, they won‚Äôt show. Go to GRR1 and check the report group assigned to GR55. Make sure the report definition includes functional area as a selection or output field.

What you can do is post a test transaction using one of the functional areas via FB50 or KB21N. Re-run GR55 and see if it appears. Double-check master data assignments and report group definitions.

entry.title: Re: User Authentication Configuration ArcGIS of SAP Servi...
entry.content:
@ rafael_umeda,

To enable you set up user authentication for ArcGIS in SAP Service and Asset Manager you should consider the following:

After registering your app in ArcGIS to get the OAuth details, you must enter these in SAP Service and Asset Manager configuration.

This is typically done in the SSAM or SAP BTP administration tools, not directly in the OData Mobile Data Configuration or the specific Data Filter/INI_PARAMETER section.

There is a dedicated section in the SSAM admin console or configuration panel such as Geospatial Framework Settings where you provide the ArcGIS OAuth credentials and redirect URI Please note that the Redirect URI you use is the one supplied by SSAM.

Please check your SSAM or SAP BTP application's OAuth client configuration for the correct value.

Hope this helps.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Dynamic safety stock
entry.content:
Intro: 
Instead of ordering a fixed quantity or period, the system plans so that after procurement the stock covers requirements for a certain number of days (range of coverage). The number of days can be dynamic and depends on coverage profile (min, target, max) in OMIA configuration. Took reference from Link
Main part:
OMIA configuration


Determine average requirements
No of periods = 3 months. So system will consider the requirements from 3 months to calculate the average.
Master data
Assign it to material master in MRP 2 view of MM02

Create requirements PIR in MD61

MRP results in MD04

On clicking summation button in MD04 you can see the below.

Logic for calcualtion

MonthPIRPeriod

As per ROC config		Days in period
Period x Days in period		Average daily Req
(M1 PIR + M2 PIR + M3 PIR) / Days in period		Target ROC
As per ROC config		Target stock
Average Daily req x Target ROC		Receipts PR/PO
PIR + current Target stock - previous target stock

entry.title: Delivering more transparency: tags in test plans are now available
entry.content:
We‚Äôre excited to share that one of the most requested improvements in our testing workflow has just been delivered: tags for test plans.

 

From Request to Reality

It all started with an improvement request:

‚ÄúWe would like to use tags within test plans.‚Äù (https://influence.sap.com/sap/ino/#/idea/326731)

The challenge was clear: until now, there was no simple way to classify or group test plans. Teams had to rely on naming conventions or external documentation to keep track of different types of tests, which made filtering and organizing test activities more difficult than it needed to be.

 

The Opportunity 

By introducing tags, we open the door to better classification and organization. Test plans can now be enriched with labels directly in Test Plan editing:

This gives teams the flexibility to tailor the classification to their exact needs and testing strategies.

 

The Benefits

With tags, test management becomes:

  • More transparent ‚Äì It‚Äôs clear at a glance which area or purpose a test plan supports.

  • Easier to filter ‚Äì Quickly find the test plans you need by applying tags.

  • More efficient ‚Äì Reduce time spent searching and increase focus on execution.

Ultimately, this enhancement strengthens test planning and execution, giving teams a smarter, more structured way to manage their test landscape.

 

Looking Ahead

The delivery of ‚Äútags for test plans‚Äù is another step toward making test management more flexible, powerful, and user-friendly. We‚Äôre excited to see how teams will make use of this new feature in their daily work.

Have feedback or ideas for further improvements? We‚Äôd love to hear from you‚Äîbecause the best features always start with your requests. Paste your improvement request here: https://influence.sap.com/sap/ino/#/campaign/3501
